document.title: Glass Ceiling Commission - A Solid Investment : Making Full Use of the Nation's Human Capital
document.abstract: The final report of the Glass Ceiling Commission, issued November 1995. Title II of the Civil Rights Act of 1991 created the 21-member, bipartisan Federal Glass Ceiling Commission. The Commissionâ€™s mandate was to study the barriers to the advancement of minorities and women within corporate hierarchies (the problem known as the glass ceiling), to issue a report on its findings and conclusions, and to make recommendations on ways to dismantle the glass ceiling.
